benchmark_details.name: MELT (Multimodal Emotion-Lines Dataset Labeled with LLM ContexTKnowledge)
benchmark_details.overview: MELT is a multimodal emotion dataset fully annotated by GPT-4o using a context-aware automatic annotation method, showcasing the application of LLMs in generating reliable, scalable annotations for speech emotion recognition.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To develop a context-aware annotation method using GPT-4o for multimodal emotion data and demonstrate its effectiveness compared to traditional methods.

data.source: Derived from the Multimodal EmotionLines Dataset (MELD), utilizing audio data from the sitcom 'Friends'.
data.annotation: Automated annotation using GPT-4o; leveraging structured prompts for consistency.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated as the average of predictions across multiple emotion recognition datasets.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better model performance in recognizing emotions across the datasets.
methodology.baseline_results: MELT consistently outperformed MELD in SER tasks.
methodology.validation: Validation through subjective experiments and objective evaluations across various emotion recognition datasets.
